title: If we have 180 days in our school year, then how many weeks are in my school year? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer: 18 weeks Two semesters of 90 class days (“contact time"). Most schools have an assortment of holidays, vacation, staff only days, etc. It's certainly not a simple math equation, given all of the variables! For comparison, here are 2 of US's biggest, public school districts calendars--one from each coast: A. New York Public Schools: http://schools.nyc.gov/NR/rdonlyres/5AADFD2F-8F44-4CB6-B057-00ED98007BFA/0/201718SchoolYearCalendar_FamilyFriendly.pdf B. Los Angeles Public Schools: https://achieve.lausd.net/site/handlers/filedownload.ashx?moduleinstanceid=34826&dataid=43843&FileName=Board%20Approved%20Single%20Track%20Cal%202017-2018.pdf TL/DR: 18 weeks…. 2, 90 school day semesters. Typically, ~180 day school year.

The typical school year is 36 weeks for the students. This will usually be spread over about 39–40 weeks, because of days teachers have that are the non-instructional days and not every week is a straight Monday -Friday arrangements. There are holidays, and other reasons why school is out, such as usually Christmas break will be two weeks, but will start and stop based on what day Christmas and New Years Day are on the calendar that year. Spring break, and fall break, in schools that have these will be about a week or at least three days. Then, there are days that teacher work, prior to the opening and closing of the school year. I have worked in systems where there was a day or at least a half day that is at the at the end of each quarter, which is usually a day for entering grades, closing the quarter and preparing for the next quarter. Some places in the state where I live have days off at the time of State Teacher’s Convention.
